title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown initially disliked Titans coach Mike Vrabel, noting he wrote 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during meetings.
Brown's relationship with Vrabel improved after understanding Vrabel's high expectations and accountability principles.
Brown, now frequently linked as a trade candidate, previously excelled under Vrabel, achieving 1,000 receiving yards in his rookie season.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: US women's hockey team declined President Trump's State of the Union invitation due to scheduling conflicts with academic and professional commitments.
US men’s hockey team, gold medal winners over Canada, is invited to State of the Union and a White House event.
Scheduling conflicts affect both U.S. hockey teams with NCAA and PWHL commitments for women and NHL resumption for men.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson, freeing up over $3 million in cap space for the team.
Gibson, 27, suffered a torn ACL in 2025 and did not have guaranteed money in the final contract year.
New England seeks depth at running back, with Stevenson, Henderson, Jennings, Mitchell, and Larison remaining on the roster.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
A blizzard requires low visibility under 1/4 mile for three hours and sustained winds of 35 mph or more.
The blizzard warning may cause power outages, tree damage, and hazardous travel, effective until 7 a.m. Tuesday.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Jack Coen captured blizzard conditions in downtown Boston with fierce winds and near-whiteout snow on Monday.
The National Weather Service warned of 18-24 inches of snowfall and damaging wind gusts across Massachusetts.
Snow accumulation reached 14 inches at 1Lofts mill apartments in Pawtucket, R.I. by Monday morning.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton responded to Tom Brady's podcast comments, stating he tops the list for receiving his RKO move.
Brady joked about WWE's athleticism during a conversation with Logan Paul before the Fanatics Flag Football Classic.
Orton is preparing for his 10th WWE elimination chamber match, aiming to compete at Wrestlemania 42.

title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet, Cape Cod recorded the highest wind gust at 83 mph, similar to a Category 1 hurricane.
Many Massachusetts locations reported wind gusts in the 60-70 mph range during Monday's storm.
Chatham AP recorded a gust of 77 mph, the second highest after Wellfleet, early Monday morning.

title: LeBron James on Jaylen Brown’s MVP chances: ‘I don’t understand’ why he’s not being talked about
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: LeBron James questions why Jaylen Brown isn't more seriously considered for NBA MVP despite strong statistics and team performance.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, placing him just outside the top-five MVP candidates.
The Celtics, expected to rebuild, are second in the Eastern Conference, fueled by Brown's performance amid significant lineup changes.

title: Wachusett delayed opening, ski resorts putting lifts on wind hold
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Wachusett Mountain delayed its opening to 11 a.m. on Monday due to a nor'easter and strong winds.
A state of emergency was declared in Massachusetts amid wind gusts of 60-70 mph and 18-24 inches of snow.
Mount Snow, VT and Gunstock, NH also faced lift hold and reduced speed operations due to severe winds.

title: Photo scroll: Blizzard whips across Mass. with heavy snow, high winds
author: Samantha Genzer and Jack Pickell
bullets: A major blizzard hit the Northeast, dropping over 2 feet of snow in some Massachusetts areas on Monday.
Snow removal efforts are underway, with streets being cleared in Boston, Marshfield, and Chatham during the storm.
High winds and heavy snowfall impacted public transportation and daily activities across the region, including Boston Common.
